comment: There was a lot of reading but as long as you do what she asks and study her review questions you will do fine. The subject is fairly easy.

This class was fairly easy. There's a lot of reading but you can listen to the textbook. The discussion software is a little confusing at first but you'll get the hang of it! I'd recommend this class to knock out science

Professor Agan knows what she is doing and is great at it! She IS very homework heavy so be prepared if you are online! During exam weeks she WILL still have regular homework and labs PLUS the exam so plan accordingly! Exams are never hard as the homework is always on the exams!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: she isn't a horrible professor, she definitely cares but she doesn't go out of her way to make the course easier. Much of the work is just questions and no real detail or reasoning to them.

This was not a fly-by online class. This professor assigned an enormous amount of work. While the modules were organized, you were not sure what to study for the tests. She provides hw assignments, readings, and lab quizzes. 5 exams + final (exempt if you have 89.5 above). Be prepared to work if you want an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: This class was total chaos.  Very disorganized, too much clicking around for answers.  Instructor is rude.

Not my fav prof tbh. Teste are super long and lockdown and webcam. No notes allowed also. When you ask her a question she tells you to just read over the content again. She seems sweet fr but as a teacher she didn't do me much good. It's an easy class sure but a overwhelming amount of work is given and the content in the test are not made clear. -1

I was struggling a lot with this class at first until I realized that the practice quizzes were the exact same as the tests, just with a few questions added from extra reading material she provides. The discussions we had to do were pretty annoying, but they weren't hard. Same thing for the labs.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Majority of the learning is self guided (online) and relied heavily on powerpoints and textbook readings. Tests weren't too hard but they definitely relied on you reading everything that was assigned. As a professor though she was awesome, she reached out to check in because she actually cares about students doing well in her class.

The workload and class overall was hard for me however she is an awesome teacher. Grades fast and responds to emails fast. Very passionate about what she does. Work isnt exactly hard but it feels like alot sometimes. Tests use camera and the final extra credit is 166 questions. Straightforward grading and gives lots of study tips. 100% recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Suzanne Agan is a good professor, she does give alot of homework, labs and exams but they are all based off the labs. Her checklist if very helpful to help students keep track of what needs to be done. If you have an A by the end of the semester she makes the final Exam optional. I would take her again if I had too.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Great professor but a LOT of work. A lab every week with 4 discussions. Tests are really easy to study for.  Exempts students above a 89.5, very passionate teacher and gives small fun fact, current news updates about the environment.

I did get a little overwhelmed with the work. Total of 4 discussions. Every week we had a lab to do, a total of 12 labs/lab quizzes for the semester. 5 tests for the number of units and there is a final exam. She only provided one extra credit assignment. Make sure to the read the textbook, articles and watch the videos, it will be on the test!

The course includes 4 Packback discussions (respond to 2 peers), 5 MES assignments w/ paired quizzes, 12 weekly lab quizzes (labs ungraded), & 5 lockdown exams. Lowest lab, quiz, discussion, & activity grades are dropped. Assignments are manageable with a weekly checklist. An 89.5+ exempts you from the final. 2 extra credit options are offered.
She is really sweet, just pay attention to due dates and you will be fine. A lot of assignments although they are super easy!

I took her over the summer. She squeezed a 15 week course into an 8 week course but it was still easy as long as you do the work. She has lockdown/webcam exams but they're all easy. Put in minimal studying and do the work and it's an A.
10/10 she was very kind and made the course easy to understand and comprehend. She also had a lot of extra credit opportunities and curved some exams.

She was a great professor and I would retake her as the class was fairly easy, HOWEVER, her test is questionable. She does not tell you what to expect on her exam so be prepared to remember everything she posts during that unit as it will be on the test. Whether it's a TED talk or an article, otherwise, the quiz and test are easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Agan is truly a sweet professor. All assignments including labs are straight forward and easy! Tests were a bit difficult at first but i quickly learned that studying the MES helped. Communicate!!! I even got exempted from my final for having an A and taking all the tests. Just stay focused and apply yourself! I would 100% take her again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She doesn't really teach, almost every question on tests is based on memorizing information from articles she posts. Prepare for at least a lab and quiz on it every week, as well as textbook quizzes and work. She's really nice her class structure specifically with the articles is odd and something I've never had another professor do.

She wasn't bad at all it was just the amount of work. Each week there's a lab quiz which is pointless because she doesn't grade the labs you do just the quiz. Tests weren't horrible but it's on a lockdown browser and no notes allowed. She also has 166 question test review so the work was overall really time consuming.

You can tell she really knows what she's talking about and that she has a passion for her field of study. That being said, if you have a busy schedule this class is not for you, as most of her assignments take a long time to complete each week. She drops lowest quiz and MES activity grades.

I have LOVED taking this course with Dr. Agan. I am not a science major and was very nervous about my ability to keep up. Well, this course was a breeze! In order to be successful in the course, all you need to do is study the textbook activities and D2L module questions. To anyone nervous about SCI 1101- I can't recommend Dr. Agan enough.
She seems really nice. Posts announcements with fun facts, tells what to study to do well on exams, it's a decent amount of work, but it isn't too hard. Lowest lab and activities grade dropped.

Do not take this professor unless this is the field you plan to go into. She is unclear on what she is putting on her quizzes and will test you on the non-mandatory material. If you have 3+ hours a week you can spend dedicated to just reading her assignments and another 2+ hours studying, go for it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: If I could give her a 4.5 I would, it was all pretty clear. You are graded on discussions, MES activities, and quizzes, you have lab quizzes, and 6 exams including a final (the exams are lockdown and webcam) for exams do study the MES quizzes and activities, and read all the posts she does bc she takes information from there to add to the exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Take this professor! She's really great and the work in the class is very straightforward.The exams were lockdown and webcam but if you study the chapter homework quizzes, you will do great.

I did the bare minimum, never did labs and still passed with a B. Exams are on lockdown but you can find study guides on quizlet to help you. She provides a good amount of extra credit, and she is super sweet. There is no makeup work though.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof. Agan is amazing! I waited an extra semester to take this class with her and I'm so glad I did! There is some reading and homework but it is all simple and very manageable. She makes the class fun and is always available to answer questions. She gears the class toward non-science majors which is helpful. Overall it was a fantastic experience.

Dr. Agan is nice! The class is easy but there is a lot of homework. Her tests are on lockdown. The test is mostly from the MES assignments and the rest of the information she posted throught the unit. She has very interesting facts and it shows that she loves nature and everything connected with it.

Professor Agan is very experienced in her field of work, you can tell by the random facts she post every week. In my opinion, the test were worth too much for what we basically had to memorize. She also gave a lab quiz and test in the same week as well, for the workload students already have to deal with, it kind of adds unnecessary pressure.

Tests are on LockDown. Most questions are straight from the quizzes, and the rest are pretty easy if you can define the bold terms in the textbook. Take notes! The lowest lab, quiz, and MES activity were dropped, and the online class had only one short discussion post, though it was graded a bit harshly. Otherwise, an easy A if you do all the work.
She's ok and the class is fairly easy but she's not helpful at all. She clearly states to send an email if you have questions but does not reply on time. she's a no for me.

The chapter assignments were extremely simple and easy to complete. The tests were composed of the MES assignments and questions from the module. She also provides some extra credit in case you want to boost your grade. Take her!! She's really nice, friendly, and cares about your learning/enjoyment. Just put effort and you'll do just fine!

Exams were ridiculous to the point she might as well not taught out of the textbook. Busy work was ridiculous. The fact that I am going to have to retake SCI 1101 because of her teaching methods angers me. Big waste of money and time. She is too busy trying to have fun with us instead of being an actual professor.

Take the quizzes, do MES assignments, drill yourself on quiz answers in advance of the test, and familiarize yourself with her extra materials as those are also tested. If you do all these, you should be able to get an A or B. If you have an A average after the 3rd exam, you can exempt the final! This prof is very warm and supportive.
Professor Agan is so sweet. I recommend taking her class because of how easy the work is.This class was a easy A, and very informative about the assignment.

Great professor! She is very experienced in her field and has great insight into the content. Very light load. Study the homework answers for the test, it is the same content. Make sure to watch the extra videos she assigns as they are on the test too. Very informative class and kind professor. Great pick!

I love professor Agan, she really cares about the material she is teaching and provides lots of resources for you to look at for each unit. Make sure you do all your work, as it helps out a LOT for her tests! I have no complaints whatsoever, she is an amazing professor!

Exam uses Lockdown, but are straight from the quizes, & articles she posts. All you need to do is memorize the answers on quizes word for word. 1 Lab each week. Chapter quiz every other week with 2 quizes making sure you read. Most answers are online and are open book. Great teacher, just do the work, and you will pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: She is the best professor at AMU. She cares about her student; she is the best environmental science professor you can get, period.
Dr. Agan was engaging, helpful, creative, and made the class fun! She is passionate about her job and her students succeeding.

Dr. Agan is a fantastic teacher. She is so passionate about the subject that it makes learning even easier. The assignments are not hard but require you to read the textbook. The tests are straight from your quizzes and readings. Labs are simple but require a little bit of time. I would definitely take her again. Cares a lot about her students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Agan was very organized throughout the entire course. As someone who needs clarity and organization in school, her setup was extremely helpful and she was always extremely encouraging. She is an amazing professor but is by no means a pushover (as she shouldn't be). It is very hard to get lost in this course.

She is a great professor and she strives for participation. She uses different methods of teaching and tries to engage her students. Most of the tests are on the homework questions and itâ€™s always good to pay attention during lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Agan is a great teacher online & made a class that's very easy to be boring overall pretty interesting. 3-4 tests & a final exam that is pretty easy as long as you read the chapters & articles. Really sweet person & you can tell she's very knowledgeable about what she teaches, if you have the opportunity to take her definitely do it
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Agan was awesome! She has a real passion for biology and often talked about her real-life experiences and their relation to the topics. She also really enjoys films and has multiple outside resources for teaching. Overall I really enjoyed this class and would definitely recommend it.
beginning of class is kinda hard but one you know what to expect on the tests, it becomes really easy.

So this is probably your best choice for sci 1101. Im pretty sad she filled up quickly for 1102 I wouldve taken her again. Everything is laid out, you just have to stay on top of it. Mes assignments, reading quiz, lab quiz, exams. Always due by Sunday. Reading quizzes and mes are usually on quizlet, lab quizzes kinda hard, exams just study.

SCI1101 was great with her... Her expectations on the tests are straight forward and she lets you know everything in order to get an A. She cares about how you do in the class and wants all her students to succeed. Easy A

While her assignments are doable and her tests are incredibly easy, her expectations are too much for the labs. With one specific lab, she had us give utility bill information, measure all our windows in our house, figure out what material our house was built with, etc. But then, the kids who live in dorms just get to put whatever. Not cool.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Class was extremely easy. HOWEVER- one thing about her... she does not want to see you pass. Meaning, she's not helpful at A L L. Technical difficulty? ZERO, can't make it up. Even when it's not your fault AND you've contacted IT, she still will not be understanding and considerate. Not to mention her sweet and sour emails when you have an issue.

This class was very easy! Not a lot of material to study except around 20 pages every 2 weeks or so. The main content is just doing quizzes for labs. Unit tests are very straightforward. Professor isnt uptight and jokes around a lot in announcements. This class wont stress you at all especially because a lot of the questions are common knowledge!

I had Dr. Agan for the lab portion of ENVS2202k and she was just amazing. She really cares about her students passing with a good grade and is quick to reply if she is emailed with questions. She is a very fun professor who plays movie soundtracks before and during lab. She is very knowledgable on the material and overall a great professor.

If the pandemic hadn't changed this to an online class, this professor may have succeeded. Online, she was an  utter failure . More often than not she couldn't figure out the technology, she didn't show up for class, the materials weren't posted or were unclear. Her shortcomings made the class stressful when it didn't need to be. Avoid!

She is the sweetest. Pretty basic class. If you do the weekly assignments you will be fine. The test are very course based, read the weekly articles and do the assignments and the tests will be pretty easy. She is very easy to talk to and is very caring.
Dr. Agan is a solid choice. She really cares about us even though it's an online course. There is a lot of homework but it can be done in an hour per week. Extra credit opportunities. I recommend.

This class is mostly reading, but it is not difficult. The chapters are about 20 pages, & she'll assign articles of varying lengths & amounts based on if there's a chapter due. Hw & quizzes are quick & simple. Tests are straightforward. She genuinely cares about your success & is really nice. She knows a lot about sustainability.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Definitely take Professor Agan! She's an amazing professor and person. She gives us weekly inspiration which honestly means a lot. She gives a full week to do assignments. Extra credit opportunities (2) but really simple. Tests super easy just like the assignments (no curve balls). major not related to science? TAKE PROF AGAN

She is an amazing teacher who tells you exactly what is expected. Quiz every week and every other week was some reading assignments but it wasnt too hard of work. She definitely cares and wants you succeed.

Professor Agan is the kind of professor that actually wants to see you pass. There were four unit exams, 12 lab quizzes, and 12 chapter activities. Science has never been my strong suit, but she made it very easy to pass. This was hands down one of the easiest science classes I have taken so far. She even drops your lowest exam score.

I am so happy I chose to take my science credit with Dr. Agan. Science isn't my favorite subject, but she made this class so interesting which helped catch my attention. She posts videos to help her students understand the content better, and not to mention, the videos are actually pretty cool! I strongly recommend her! Amazing professor!
I enjoyed the SCI 1101 class with Professor Again so much I waited until I could get her to take SCI 1102. She is a super sweet lady and is really interested in the topic she teaches.

Okay the tests were a little hard, and the labs were annoying but overall good class. I didnt rlly do the labs bc they aren't graded and I ended with a A in class, but the quizzes have some lab questions on it so at least review the labs. All the tests are over the current events so just watch the videos and read them. seems a lot but easy

She is so sweet, very passionate about the course, and is more than willing to help students and provide resources for further learning. We cover a chapter and have an online assignment each week. The assignments are easy, check quizlet. Three exams and a final, study notes for the exams. If you have an A you can exempt the final. 2 discussions.

Dr Agan is lovely but her class could be a bit much at times. She packs a lot of extra content into the class and quizzes you on long random youtube videos. If you can get past that it's not a bad class. She drops the lowest grade on all sections so it's not hard to get a good grade and if you have an A you can exempt from the final.

Science is not my strong subject, but Prof. Agan made this class very smooth and not difficult. Very flexible and very quick on emails. Keeps class interesting and does kahoot for extra points. The assignments and quizzes are very straightforward and what you actually learn in class. Textbook is online, but she teaches exactly for her tests.

Really easy and great class. I enjoyed the material. Usually every week, there is a quiz and a lab. Then before the test is due, there are assignments for the chapters and a lab quiz due. The tests are easy. She offers extra credit. She also dropped the lowest test, chapter assignment, and quiz grade.

her class is an easy A but miss one thing and she wont work with you or help you out at all. she can be rude to students who just need help but overall the class is easy and she gives opportunity to bring up your grades. stay on track with the work and u will do great
Her online SCI 1102 class was super easy! She's really nice and will answer relatively quick to emails. I didn't really put much effort (thx quizlet) and still got a soild A.

One of my top ten teachers by far. She is the sweetest professor and really cares about what she teaches. Lots of connect homework, but nothing hard. She tries to make it as interesting as possible, and will help you if you reach out. She's super understanding and caring. 10/10 take her if you can!!

Take for an easy A for online science. You have to purchase Pearson for homework and quizzes but test are on D2L and are not lockdown. She offered an easy extra credit assignment. She will help with any problems quickly through email. I've taken her twice and gotten A's both times without ever studying

Best professor I have had at KSU. She is so nice and actually cares about her students. assignments are all online. 3 exams and the final is super easy as long as you study the review. There are activities and chapter quizzes that are due before each exam which are not hard at all. TAKE HER
Professor Agan is great, you definitely need to take her! You need to do the work and study for her tests, if you do that you will be fine. I wish I had taken her for SCI 1101.
Take her! If you get the chance take her class! I had her for 1101 as well and LOVED her then. She's caring, passionate about what she's teaching, and doesn't overload with work.

Professor Agan is one of my favorite professors at KSU and I am not a science major. She made her basic science credit class into a great learning environment where she got many students engaged in what she was teaching. She went above and beyond for all her students 10/10
Mrs Agan is a great professor! She's so passionate about her job and makes class fun, most adorable human ever. 10/10 would take her again!!!!

Professor Agan was awesome! She was very understanding especially during the whole COVID-19 thing and she made the class easy, fun, and interesting. I didn't use the textbook and I was able to pass the class with an A!

She is one of the best Professor's I've had at Kennesaw! She's very caring and helpful. She gives you all of your assignments ahead of time and gives clear explanations of what she expects. The class itself is pretty easy. I took this class online but she still tries to make it fun. She also drops some of your lowest grades at the end of semester!

Professor agan is the best Professor Ive ever taken. She is a super sweet lady who clearly cares a lot about what shes teaching, but dosent make the class insanely difficult. Tests are very simple to study for and she always does everything she can to make her class time fun and engaging. Wonderful Professor, will definitely take again

Professor Agan is a good professor and while her class is easy, it is not to be taken lightly. Students should make sure to keep up with assignments or else they could risk getting a poor grade in a relatively simple class. All of her test questions and quiz questions are found on Quizlet or on her video lectures so remember to keep up with those.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Take professor Agan, for an easy A in SCI1101. All homework and quizzes are on Pearson but not lockdown. Lab Quizzes and Tests are on d2l, not lockdown, and are very easy to pass. I bought the textbook and never opened it once, and finished with an A+ so the textbook is not necessary to purchase. If you need help, she emails back quickly.
